root.pub-comments: "Kechua is a language complex like Romance, Misteko, or Sapoteko. There is a great deal of internal diversification." (70)
root.publications: Kaufman, Terrence. 2007. Atlas of the World's Languages, 2 edn., 70. London, New York: Routledge.

child.publications: Kaufman, Terrence. 2007. Atlas of the World's Languages, 2 edn., 70. London, New York: Routledge.
Kaufman, Terrence. 2007. Atlas of the World's Languages, 2 edn., 70. London, New York: Routledge.

child.pub-comments: "The Qalawaya jargon (Callahuaya) of Bolivia is used by about ten Kechua speakers who (apparently) used to speak Pukina, or in any event a language related to Pukina. Qalawaya is also called Pohena. It is not known where all its components come from." (70)
child.publications: Kaufman, Terrence. 2007. Atlas of the World's Languages, 2 edn., 70. London, New York: Routledge.
